  16. #ifndef CAML_BACKTRACE_PRIM_H
  17. ‌#define CAML_BACKTRACE_PRIM_H

  19. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  21. #include "backtrace.h"

  23. /* Backtrace generation is split in [backtrace.c] and [backtrace_prim].
  24. *
  25. * [backtrace_prim] contains all backend-specific
  26. * code, and has two different
  27. * implementations in [runtime/backtrace_byt.c] and [runtime/backtrace_nat.c].
  28. *
  29. * [backtrace.c] has a unique implementation, and exposes a uniform
  30. * higher level API above [backtrace_{byt,nat}.c].
  31. */

  33. /* Extract location information for the given raw_backtrace_slot */

  35. ‌struct caml_loc_info {
  36.   int loc_valid;
  37.   int loc_is_raise;
  38.   char * loc_filename;
  39.   char * loc_defname;
  40.   int loc_lnum;
  41.   int loc_startchr;
  42.   int loc_endchr;
  43.   int loc_is_inlined;
  44. };

  46. /* When compiling with -g, backtrace slots have debug info associated.
  47. * When a call is inlined in native mode, debuginfos form a sequence.
  48. */
  49. ‌typedef void * debuginfo;

  51. /* Check availability of debug information before extracting a trace.
  52. * Relevant for bytecode, always true for native code. */
  53. int caml_debug_info_available(void);

  55. /* Check load status of debug information for the main program. This is always 1
  56. * for native code. For bytecode, it is 1 if the debug information has been
  57. * loaded, 0 if it has not been loaded or one of the error constants in
  58. * startup.h if something went wrong loading the debug information. */
  59. int caml_debug_info_status(void);

  61. /* Return debuginfo associated to a slot or NULL. */
  62. debuginfo caml_debuginfo_extract(backtrace_slot slot);

  64. /* In case of an inlined call return next debuginfo or NULL otherwise. */
  65. debuginfo caml_debuginfo_next(debuginfo dbg);

  67. /* Extract locations from backtrace_slot */
  68. void caml_debuginfo_location(debuginfo dbg, /*out*/ struct caml_loc_info * li);

  70. /* In order to prevent the GC from walking through the debug
  71.    information (which have no headers), we transform slots to 31/63 bits
  72.    ocaml integers by shifting them by 1 to the right. We do not lose
  73.    information as slots are aligned.

  75.    In particular, we do not need to use [caml_modify] when setting
  76.    an array element with such a value.
  77. */
  78. ‌#define Val_backtrace_slot(bslot) (Val_long(((uintnat)(bslot))>>1))
  79. ‌#define Backtrace_slot_val(vslot) ((backtrace_slot)(Long_val(vslot) << 1))

  81. /* Allocate Caml_state->backtrace_buffer. Returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise */
  82. int caml_alloc_backtrace_buffer(void);

  84. CAMLextern void caml_free_backtrace_buffer(backtrace_slot *backtrace_buffer);

  86. #ifndef NATIVE_CODE
  87. /* These two functions are used by the bytecode runtime when loading
  88.    and unloading bytecode */
  89. value caml_add_debug_info(code_t code_start, value code_size,
  90.                                    value events_heap);
  91. value caml_remove_debug_info(code_t start);
  92. #endif

  94. ‌#define BACKTRACE_BUFFER_SIZE 1024

  96. /* Besides decoding backtrace info, [backtrace_prim] has two other
  97. * responsibilities:
  98. *
  99. * It defines the [caml_stash_backtrace] function, which is called to quickly
  100. * fill the backtrace buffer by walking the stack when an exception is raised.
  101. *
  102. * It also defines the [caml_get_current_callstack] OCaml primitive, which also
  103. * walks the stack but directly turns it into a [raw_backtrace] and is called
  104. * explicitly.
  105. */

  107. /* Runtime representation of the debug information, optimized
  108.    for quick lookup */
  109. ‌struct ev_info {
  110.   code_t ev_pc;
  111.   char *ev_filename;
  112.   char *ev_defname;
  113.   int ev_lnum;
  114.   int ev_startchr;
  115.   int ev_endchr;
  116. };

  118. /* Find the event with the given pc. */
  119. struct ev_info * caml_exact_event_for_location(code_t pc);

  121. #endif /* CAML_INTERNALS */

  123. #endif /* CAML_BACKTRACE_PRIM_H */
